pageContext.claim: “We have kids with sniffles and all of a sudden we report a case and there are no danger whatsoever.”
pageContext.analysis: Most children do not appear to get very sick from covid-19 but some have died. About two percent of the cases in the United States were of children under the age of 18, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The CDC says about 55 percent have mild or no symptoms, but nearly six percent have severe or critical illnesses. Children also can pass on the virus to older caregivers, putting them at risk.
